trustfund: TF020930-NEW ZEALAND CONSULTANTS TRUST FUND,TF032883-CHINA - AGRICULTURE DEVELOPMENT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the outcome of the project was
            highly satisfactory. The key lessons convey that the
            sustained project management successfully implemented the
            program, through the involvement of leading groups at the
            Provincial, Prefecture, and County levels, who supported
            full time management offices, thus, greatly enhancing relief
            operations. Likewise, the consistent involvement of local
            communities in reconstruction efforts, in both Inner
            Mongolia and the Yunnan Province, was an important
            participatory factor towards a satisfactory long-term
            sustainability. Furthermore, the adoption of simplified
            procurement procedures had a definite and positive impact on
            the efficiency of the program, with satisfactory compliance
            rates, even when on occasions, the lowest bid was rejected
            in lieu of high-quality work. Regardless of success, it is
            suggested that appropriate financial tracking systems should
            be in place at project inception, thus, avoiding
            implementation delays and/or sanctioning of expenditures,
            particularly for emergency lending. In addition, early
            availability of funds could be essential to address disaster
            repairs in a timely fashion.
